featured.text: Franklin ran an iron rod through a hole in the top of each hemisphere so that they could nest together from largest to smallest.
Whether they wielded rods or pea shooters, knockers-up became 18 throughout the United Kingdom.
An iron rod is used to strike the thicker glass hemispheres.
He linked all of this to a device shaped like a spinning wheel, with a foot control that turned the rod, making the glass hemispheres rotate.
What does the highlighted “they” in the second paragraph refer to? (A) Iron rods.

definition.zh_def: 一根長而細的物體，通常用於支撐、固定或作為工具。
definition.en_def: A long, thin object, often used for support, fastening, or as a tool.
definition.example: He used a rod to fish in the lake.
